titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: On Monday, the 18th of January 1847, at 4 o’clock P.M. at the house of my son, Charles Francis Adams, in Mount Vernon Street, Boston, I caused to be assembled, three persons, namely, Deacon James H. Foster, Edward Brooks and Allen. C. Spooner, all of Boston, and in their presence, I executed a paper drawn up under my direction, by my Son, during the last month, as my last Will and Testament—annulling that which I made in October 1832, and which I have mislaid so that it cannot now be found— Of the Will, now made, I have deposited a Copy, in the hands of my Son Charles, Francis, Adams, who is constituted my sole Executor, and retain the original in my own hands, to be kept, with my Bundle of Deeds—
